title: Compiler bug with misspelt enum name
body:
enum Token {
   Num(i32),
   AddSub(char),
   MulDiv(char),
   LeftParen(char),
   RightParen(char)
}

fn main() {
    println!("Hello World\n");

}
# [allow(dead_code)]

fn postfix_from_infix(infix: Vec<Token>) -> Vec<Token> {
   let postfix = Vec::<Token>::new();

   for token in infix {
      match token {
         Toekn::LeftParen(_) => break,
         _                   => {}
      }
   }

   postfix
}

```

`Toekn` [E0433]
main.rs:20          Toekn::LeftParen(_) => break,
                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

tion

categorization.rs:1262: enum pattern didn't resolve to enum or struct None

###################
I misspelt the enum Token as Toekn. The compiler panics.
C:\UserData\Tech\Rust\expr\src>rustc --version
rustc 1.10.0 (cfcb716cf 2016-07-03)
```
